meanings.definition: To hit or strike with the head
meanings.sent1: The soccer player nutted the ball into the goal.
meanings.sent2: He nutted the door accidentally while trying to open it quickly.
meanings.sent3: The goat nutted the fence, thinking it was a rival.
meanings.sent4: The ram nutted the tree trunk, showing its dominance.
meanings.sent5: She nutted the wall in frustration, leaving a dent.

meanings.sent1: He nutted quickly and felt relieved.
meanings.sent2: The teenager nutted in embarrassment during the movie scene.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about nutting at the wrong moment.
meanings.sent4: The volcano nutted lava into the air, creating a spectacle.
meanings.sent5: The pressure built up until he finally nutted, releasing tension.

meanings.definition: To tighten or secure with a nut
meanings.sent1: He nutted the bolt to keep the machine in place.
meanings.sent2: She carefully nutted the wheel onto the bicycle.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic nutted the screws tightly to prevent any issues.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter nutted the joints together for a sturdy frame.
meanings.sent5: He nutted the lid onto the jar, sealing it shut.
